children.textContent: Test: Line Height and Leading

Line-height: normal
            
                This text uses the normal line-height, which is typically around 1.2 times the font size. This creates comfortable reading spacing.
            
        
        
        
            Line-height: 1 (no leading)
            
                This text uses line-height: 1, meaning no extra space between lines. Text may appear cramped with descenders touching ascenders.
            
        
        
        
            Line-height: 1.5
            
                This text uses line-height: 1.5, providing generous spacing between lines for improved readability.
            
        
        
        
            Line-height: 2 (double spacing)
            
                This text uses line-height: 2, creating double-spaced text like traditional typewritten documents.
            
        
        
        
            Line-height: 40px (fixed)
            
                This text uses a fixed line-height of 40px, regardless of font size changes.
            
        
        
        
            Mixed font sizes with line-height: 1.5
            
                Small text and 
                normal text and 
                large text all sharing the same line-height multiplier.
            
        
        
        
            Baseline grid visualization
            
                This text is laid out on a baseline grid. The red lines show where the baselines should align for consistent vertical rhythm.
            
        
    
    
    
    
    {
        "test_id": "box_010_line_height",
        "category": "baseline",
        "features": ["line-height", "leading", "baseline-grid", "vertical-rhythm", "font-size-interaction"],
        "description": "Line-height property behavior with various values and its interaction with baseline alignment",
        "spec_references": ["https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS22/visudet.html#line-height"],
        "complexity": "intermediate"
    }
